00016 #define NINJA_CLEAN_H_
00017 
00018 #include <string>
00019 #include <set>
00020 using namespace std;
00021 
00022 struct State;
00023 struct BuildConfig;
00024 struct Node;
00025 struct Rule;
00026 
00027 class Cleaner
00028 {
00029 public:
00030   /// Constructor.
00031   Cleaner(State* state, const BuildConfig& config);
00032 
00033   /// Clean the given @a target and all the file built for it.
00034   void CleanTarget(Node* target);
00035   int CleanTargets(int target_count, char* targets[]);
00036 
00037   /// Clean all built files.
00038   void CleanAll();
00039 
00040   /// Clean all the file built with the given rule @a rule.
00041   void CleanRule(const Rule* rule);
00042   int CleanRules(int rule_count, char* rules[]);
00043 
00044 private:
00045   /// Remove the file @a path.
00046   /// @return whether the file has been removed.
00047   bool RemoveFile(const string& path);
00048   /// @returns whether the file @a path exists.
00049   bool FileExists(const string& path);
00050   void Report(const string& path);
00051   /// Remove the given @a path file only if it has not been already removed.
00052   void Remove(const string& path);
00053   /// @return whether the given @a path has already been removed.
00054   bool IsAlreadyRemoved(const string& path);
00055   /// Helper recursive method for CleanTarget().
00056   void DoCleanTarget(Node* target);
00057   void PrintHeader();
00058   void PrintFooter();
00059   void DoCleanRule(const Rule* rule);
00060 
00061 private:
00062   State* state_;
00063   bool verbose_;
00064   bool dry_run_;
00065   set<string> removed_;
00066 };
